G3_build_succeeds.notes: Passed after manual fix for case-sensitivity (Components vs components) and TypeScript error (isFront prop on ReferenceDot).

G9_chart_renders_data.notes: Scatter plot renders mapped data points.

G10_tooltips_implemented.notes: Custom tooltips implemented for scatter points.

failure_reasons: Project failed to build initially due to case-sensitivity and TypeScript errors.

A1_data_population.notes: Created a rich dataset with realistic data spanning all quadrants.

A2_score_normalization.notes: Correct normalization (x10) in a dedicated utility, handles clamping.

A3_quadrant_assignment.notes: Well-structured reusable utility for quadrant assignment.

A4_scatter_plot_rendering.notes: Premium chart with quadrant background zones and labels.

A5_tooltip_implementation.notes: Shows Title, Quadrant, Effort, and Impact. Solid but basic styling.

A6_logic_ui_separation.notes: Exemplary separation of concerns in the matrix pipeline.

A_strategy_matrix.category_commentary: The Strategy Matrix implementation is excellent, with high marks for data quality, transformation logic, and visualization.

B1_project_setup.evidence: Build failed on Linux due to case-sensitivity.
B1_project_setup.notes: Functional but has notable issues that break cross-platform builds.

B2_routing_navigation.notes: Only /matrix route implemented; navigation is missing.

B3_type_safety.evidence: StrategyMatrix.tsx props and loadProjects any types.
B3_type_safety.notes: Basic TypeScript usage; some type safety gaps.

B4_data_layer.notes: Functional pipeline using gray-matter; basic but works.

B_technical_foundation.category_commentary: Technical foundation is the weakest area, primarily due to the build failure and missing navigation/routing structure.

C1_visual_design.notes: Clean and functional but lacks professional polish and design token usage.

C2_responsive_design.notes: Chart resizes, but layout is very basic.

C4_empty_error_loading_states.notes: No skeletons or dedicated empty/error states.

C_ui_ux_quality.category_commentary: UI/UX meets the bare minimum but misses several PRD requirements like loading skeletons and design token integration.

D2_quadrant_logic_accuracy.notes: Perfect match to PRD quadrant definitions.

D3_route_structure.notes: Missing Dashboard, Roadmap, and Project Library.

D4_specification_details.notes: High adherence to matrix specs; missed secondary details like cmd+k.

D_prd_compliance.category_commentary: High compliance on the core Matrix requirement, but failed to implement the broader application structure.

E1_separation_of_concerns.evidence: Clean folder structure for src/lib and src/components.
E1_separation_of_concerns.notes: Exemplary architecture for the parts implemented.

E2_readability_naming.notes: Code is very clean, well-named, and self-documenting.

E_code_quality.category_commentary: Code quality is very high; the candidate writes clean, maintainable logic.

G1_prioritization.notes: Prioritized the core requirement and data quality over breadth.

G2_pr_description.notes: Structured summary explaining decisions and technical choices.

G_decision_making.category_commentary: Good prioritization of the must-have, but lack of bonus features limits the score.

H1_commit_cadence.notes: Shows incremental progress from scaffold to implementation.

automatic_failure_reasons: Project failed to build initially due to case-sensitivity (Components vs components) and TypeScript errors.

top_strengths: Excellent data transformation logic in matrix.ts with perfect PRD adherence.
High code readability and clean separation of concerns.
Rich synthetic dataset (7 projects) that tells a coherent story.
top_weaknesses: Fragile build configuration (case-sensitivity issue) that breaks on Linux.
Ignored design tokens and global configuration requirements.
standout_moments: The quadrant background shading and labels in the scatter plot are very well done.
qualitative_summary.hiring_signal: This candidate is a strong 'logic and data' developer but lacks the holistic 'product' focus required for a senior role. They write very clean, maintainable code for specific features but struggle with cross-platform build considerations and broader application architecture. They would thrive in a backend-leaning frontend role or as part of a team where a senior developer provides the architectural scaffolding.
